message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.CL. 

This paper is about computing query-document similarity in an ecommerce search engine, which is a fundamental problem in information retrieval (IR). Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a novel way of deriving image information for queries using canonical correlation analysis (CCA), which involves learning a new subspace where projecting the original data will give a new query and item representation. This involves using item images to learn image information for queries, which suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.CV (computer vision) and cs.MM (multimedia). Additionally, the paper uses a vector space model to estimate query-item similarity, which is a common technique in machine learning and natural language processing, suggesting that the paper may also belong to cs.LG (machine learning) and cs.CL (computational linguistics).
